title: Project Calliope – A European Thematic Network for eHealth Interoperability

author: Tanja Niederländer, Federal Ministry of Health, Republic of Austria

segmentation: I would like to for Tonya Nederlander she will present us a project Kaliopi which is a project about.
Interoperability and European Health Network really look forward also for this presentation, so Tonya to resource next 20 minutes.
Thank you.
I'll try to speed up.
Yeah.
Also from my side I wonderful late good morning by now.

The Astra Ministry of Health is currently involved in two major EU projects in the topic of E Health and I think this also states how much this issue is important in our daily business and also that it's one of the seven pillars of the eagerness development center, as I think also shows that it is getting more and more important on our daily business.
What I've brought with me today is about the Kalliope project about what we're doing, what our next steps are, and also about our collaborations with other EU project.
You might be wondering that's a young woman like Miss talking to you today in a field that you're probably working much longer for now than I am.
And yeah, I guess what, you're right, but I think that's already young.

People are realizing that the health and interoperability in health is very important shows that we have reached an quite important objective, and they also see many young faces here, so I'm quite satisfied about this.

Because it's not only me, it's a large community that believes that E. Hothan interoperability health leads to a better continuity of care for the patient and also to a battle dialogue in between the different healthcare institutions and professionals.
What we also have to think about is our legal aspect aspects and also reimbursement aspects.
I know it's always tricky to to touch these topics, but they are also very important when you talk about interoperability.
At the moment it's not the problem that we're not having any data about our patients, it's more like.
That we are having it, but having it on different systems in different organizations with different girls.

And when we think about cross border healthcare, it's also in different languages that we have to think about and therefore our our local systems are national systems that we tried to implement me to be interoperable and this leads them exactly to what did climate cleopa thematic network is doing.
We're working on the theme of interoperability hop.
Um?
Basically what we are, we are a communication platform that tries to get all the stakeholders on one table having the same rights in discussions and not run national authority.

For instance, being more important in a votes than a competent center, we tried to Toledo Open dialogues, transparent dialogues and also to come up with new fuse and proposals like the interoperability road map.
And also to produce value on a national level and also for all our members.

I do not want to read this site so you because I know this is a lot on the slide, but we also asked our Members why do you believe that the Cleo pathetic network is needed and what's a good for an many answers that we received were basically to generalize them to make the Member States collaborate each other on the same issues and not working in parallel.
What's been done?

Quite for a long time in the past, so we're trying to get all our members being it from national authority from a competent center, from Health Association or whatever to come together and work on the same issue.
I'm here, brought you some general effects that you might be interested in.
Our project volume licensing amount of 500,000 Euro.
And our project has a duration of 13 months and we started in the middle of June 2008.

In the beginning we what we did was setting up a governance to finally get the project started because I guess you all know health projects are not always that easy and getting all the importance they colors on one table is sometimes quite quite hard.
But what we're trying to to do in the future, and also already nice to produce value in three priority areas, which I will talk about in more detail, but later.
And also an important fact is that we are going financed by the Commission under the sub program.

The project itself was promoted by 28 different beneficiaries coming from different countries, competence centers and health associations, and also you see, for instance, Slovenia is is part of the Member of the club with the Meta Network.
The Ministry of Health and also the.
Institute of Public Health.
And they also creation, I think at the moment we are in discussions with Bulgaria for instance as well.
OK, this was not planned.
I'm sorry, but.
OK, seeing Kelly over then a European context because you might be wondering, there's so many different initiatives already on the floor.
So why do we need Kelly open now?
Can you?

Basically you can see it as a linkage between the European Commission on the one side with all its initiatives and stakeholder groups, and on the other side with a different projects being initiated and promoted by the Commission an on the.
He has governance, for instance.
At the moment the Cleopatra Matic network was being invited to present Interoperability Road map for role of Hillside T in Barcelona.

As already mentioned before, we are having many different collaborations with different projects like the Abscess Project emended for three, and also other cross border projects like the Edge Pro card and Stroke Project where we tried to meet and talk about the different issues that concern in health, and we tried to also look where are different layers between, for instance, stork and also thinking about the identity in healthcare.
An especially with sepsis.
We have a strong collaboration.
We also have introduce.
Is the network group called Calypso?
With three major objectives.
Because the first one.
There are many Member States that were not able or could not take part in the absence one face project.
So we're trying to get them the chance to also talk about issues being discussed in the Abscess project and also an objective two to also include different stakeholders not involved in the project.
An objective three basically is about all the outcome being produced in the episodes.
Project to also use it as a basis to go on with Nicole Eop, tasks that we have to fulfill.
From project to network, in the beginning is as already stated in the beginning.

It was not so easy getting all the projects running, but then now we're trying to to move onto two more work like in the network because in the beginning we tried to stick to exactly what was written in the description of work and we had our different work groups, but by now we said that it's more important to.
Allocate our resources accordingly to the work we have to do at the moment and that's why we're not working rather on tasks than in working groups.
Now coming back to our priority areas.
As I promised before.
Um?
The first is the European Interoperability road map.
And second one, the second task that we're working on is the you recommendation on interoperability and at the urn is about standardization activities.
The interoperability road map here, what we're doing, or basically did in the past was to look at what we're having on a national basis and trying.
Also discuss with our members and stakeholders what they believe, on how far we are, and what we need and what is the basis from where we should start.
And the goal of of this task is to.
Formulate a proposal for develop healthy in Barcelona and I think or I know that this is quite enthusiastic because it's already March.
But I hope that we can hold this goal.

The reason why we're doing this is because we are basically trying to accelerate the deployment in E half and we're doing this where this needed meaning where all the priorities are and also thinking about possible future actions on this field.
Also in a European level and Nesset already in Barcelona.
Our second priority area is based on the recommendation by the Commission on Interoperability.
I guess they don't have to tell you in detail what's what it contains, but just for those who don't know, it recommends a different topics.
For instance, on a legal basis.
Also political strategies, technical and semantic interoperability monitoring, awareness training, just many different topics.
Um?
What's the color pathetic network was supposed to do?
Or is supposed to do is to look at this recommendation?
And what's the Commission did was sending out some questionnaire to the Member States asking and how far they have already implemented the recommendation.
And now we're at this stage that.
Parts of these questions were already analyzed by the color with semantic network and also in different workshops.
We have discussed the input and also tried to to go one step further to go beyond and also to develop some sort of knew guideline.
Um?
And the general findings of what have already been what has already been analyzed.

Well, basically I too have detailed political goals to also include best practice models to also look at projects being run by the Commission like the Absence project and also just think about semantic services or also to focus on on standards.
Which leads me to our.
Less priority area.
The standardization lesion, where we're working quite closely, also together with the Abscess project and also demanded for three.

Um, but our intention is even to get more involved in demanded for three activities, but all this task is at a very early stage at the moment and the the final deliverable will be some sort of standardization report.
But if you have more detailed questions on this, this task to recommend you to ask my colleague, Jeremy Thorpe, because he's.
Very much involved in the 70 leads this task.
And finally, I hope this was in time.

Um, I will kindly invite you to the world of health IT for our next open session where we try to deliver our proposal as mentioned before, and I hope that I could convince the one or the other maybe a few to also join us and make it possible to make the clear thematic network a sustainable network.
Also, after the project phase.
Thank you.
